items.message: Wednesday morning's tide at 11:30 on 02/08/2023 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather with Gale Force 8 South Westerly winds. The weather increases tide table values by 0.5 m. The total forecast tide is 5.27 metres Chart Datum (2.53 mAOD) at Chichester Harbour. For 1 hour either side of high water, the tide will flood Shore Road. At Bosham High Street, water will be near to or flood front door steps. Gardens or land of shore side properties around the Harbour could also be affected. Thursday's early morning tide is forecast to be 20cm lower, although still accompanied by large waves and strong winds (Force 5). Minor flood risks could remain until Thursday afternoon (03/08/2023) when tide levels, wind and waves should have reduced. We continue to monitor the forecast. If you have them, please install flood boards 1 hour before high tide. Avoid walking through flood water as it may contain hidden hazards and be deep in places. We will update this message by 18:00 on 02/08/2023.

Wednesday morning's tide at 11:30 on 02/08/2023 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather, with Gale Force 8 South Westerly winds and large waves. The weather increases tide table values by 0.44 m. The total forecast tide is 6.28 metres Chart Datum (3.23 mAOD) at Littlehampton. For 2 hours either side of high tide, waves could overtop the sea front, with small amounts of water affecting land and fields, and possibly properties near Climping Street Car Park. Although conditions should ease slightly through Thursday (03/08/2023), similar water levels, waves and flood risk is forecast to remain through to the early hours of Friday (04/08/2023). We continue to monitor the forecast and routinely check the condition of the beach at Climping. Shingle and debris can be thrown by large waves. Avoid walking at the sea front or parking at Climping Street Car Park. Access could be restricted during and after high tide. We will update this message by 18:00 on 02/08/2023.

There is a possibility of flooding for Christchurch Harbour and tidal stretches of the Lower Stour and Avon. Sea spray overtopping along the coast and high water levels in the harbour are forecast as a result of high spring tides. First forecast high water is 10:49 Wednesday, 02/08/23 with a level of 1.29 mAOD Force 7 South Westerley winds. 
mAOD is height above average sea level. The low pressure will cause sea levels to be higher than forecast in these tide.

Flooding to roads and low lying land is possible and conditions can apply one to two hours either side of high tide. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are closing flood gates. Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. 
This message will be updated 02/08/23, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council

items.message:
There is a possibility of flooding for Poole Harbour and tidal stretches of the Lower Frome and Piddle, particularly at Wareham. High water levels are forecast as a result of high spring tides. First forecast high water is 10:59 Wednesday, 02/08/23 with a level of 1.26 mAOD at Wareham, Force 7 South Westerly winds. Low pressure will cause sea levels to be higher than forecast in these tides.
Flooding to roads and low lying land is possible and conditions can apply one to two hours either side of high tide. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. 
This message will be updated 02/08/2023 or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Cornwall coast from Lands End to Chapel Porth
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible over high tide on the morning of Wednesday 2nd of August due to low pressure and high winds. High tide is at 06:16am at St Ives and times of high water will vary along the coast. 
Strong force 6 westerly winds and low pressure are predicted to increase tide heights by around 240mm higher than predicted.
People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast.
Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required.

items.description: North Cornwall coast from The Rumps to Hartland Point excluding Bude
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible over the high tide on the morning of Wednesday 2nd of August due to low pressure and high winds. High tide at Boscastle is at 07:14am and times of high water will vary along the coast. 
Strong force 6 westerly winds and low pressure are forecast to increase tide heights by around 400mm higher than predicted.
People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast.
Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible over high tide on the morning of Wednesday 2nd of August due to low pressure and high winds. High tide is at 06:29am at Padstow but times of high water will vary along the coast. 
Strong force 6 westerly winds and low pressure are forecast to increase tide heights by around 240mm higher than predicted.
People are advised to stay away from risk areas and take care next to the coast.
Keep up to date with weather and tide conditions on local radio. We will continue to monitor the situation and issue updates as required.

Wednesday afternoon's tide at 12:35 on 02/08/2023 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather with strong South Westerly Force 6 winds and large waves. The weather increases tide table values by 0.54 m. The total forecast tide is 5.37 metres Chart Datum (2.64 mAOD) at Portsmouth. For 1 hour either side of high water, levels will be high at South Street and Queen Street, Emsworth. The Ship Inn car park at Langstone will flood. Water will flow across the A259 junction with Lumley Road, flooding driveways. Water will flow into the road at Langstone High Street. Flood depths in the road will be up to 0.1 m deep, and should only cause impacts nearest to the harbour front. At 00:47 on Thursday (03/08/2023)‚ the tide level remains elevated but will be lower than at Wednesday lunchtime. Currently it is unlikely that it will cause flooding to property‚ but we will issue further advice tomorrow (02/08/2023). In Emsworth, we will lower levels in the Mill Pond. If you have it please install flood protection 1 hour before high tide. We will update this message by 18:00 on 02/08/2023.

Wednesday afternoon's tide at 12:15 on 02/08/2023 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather with strong Southerly Force 5 winds and large waves. The weather increases tide table values by 0.63 m. The total forecast tide is 4.96 metres Chart Datum (2.37 mAOD) at Cowes. For 1 hour either side of high water, very minor impact flooding will affect some seafront roads, esplanades and car parks across the island. Water will be high up slipways in Cowes, affecting Medina Road and the floating bridge. In East Cowes, water forced up through drains may cause minor impacts to the road at Albany Road. At 00:20 on Thursday 03/08/2023‚ the tide level remains elevated. Currently property flooding is unlikely but we will issue further advice tomorrow (02/08/2023). We continue to monitor the forecast. At Medina Road, near the floating bridge, the tide may rise to be only 0.1m below the top of front door steps. As a precautionary measure, and if you have it, we recommend that flood protection is installed at Medina Road 1 hour before high tide. We will update this message by 18:00 on 02/08/2023.

floodArea.riverOrSea: The Solent, Portsmouth Harbour, Langstone Harbour

items.message: Wednesday afternoon's tide at 12:35 on 02/08/2023 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather with strong South Westerly Force 6 winds and large waves. The weather increases tide table values by 0.54 m. The total forecast tide is 5.37 metres Chart Datum (2.64 mAOD) at Portsmouth. For 1 hour either side of high water, in Old Portsmouth, the tide may exceed the top of the main slipway which will cause minor road flooding in East Street and to the boat yards at The Camber. Spray overtopping of defence walls at Southsea promenade and Eastern Road is also expected. To protect property in Old Portsmouth, tidal defence gates will be closed. At 00:47 on Thursday 03/08/2023‚ the tide level remains elevated but will be lower than at Wednesday lunchtime. Currently it is unlikely that it will cause flooding to property‚ but we may issue further advice tomorrow 02/08/2023. We continue to monitor the forecast. Spray and large waves will carry and throw shingle and debris onto roads and footpaths. Avoid exposed sea front locations at high tide. We will remove this message by 18:00 on 02/08/2023.

Wednesday afternoon's tide at 12:35 on 02/08/2023 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather with strong South Westerly Force 6 winds and large waves. The weather increases tide table values by 0.54 m. The total forecast tide is 5.37 metres Chart Datum (2.64 mAOD) at Portsmouth. For 1 hour either side of high tide, water may just exceed the top of the main slipway, flooding the road at Lower Quay, Fareham. The lower end of Wallington Shore Road will flood to a depth of 0.1 m. Spray overtopping and subsequent debris could affect the A27 at Portchester. At 00:47 on Thursday (03/08/2023)‚ the tide level remains elevated but will be lower than at Wednesday lunchtime. Currently it is unlikely that it will cause flooding to property‚ but we may issue further advice tomorrow (02/08/2023). We continue to monitor the forecast. We recommend that cars do not park at the lower end of Wallington Shore Road. We will remove this message by 18:00 on 02/08/2023.

Wednesday afternoon's tide at 12:35 on 02/08/2023 is higher than normal due to unsettled weather with strong South Westerly Force 6 winds and large waves. The weather increases tide table values by 0.54 m. The total forecast tide is 5.37 metres Chart Datum (2.64 mAOD) at Portsmouth. For 1 hour either side of high water, spray overtopping of sea defence walls into low lying coastal roads between Hillhead and Gosport, namely Cliff Road and Stokes Bay Road, is expected. At Hillhead, low lying sea front car parks may flood. Property flooding is not expected. At 00:47 on Thursday (03/08/2023)‚ the tide level remains elevated but will be lower than at Wednesday lunchtime. Currently it is unlikely that it will cause flooding to property‚ but we may issue further advice tomorrow (02/08/2023). We continue to monitor the forecast. Be careful if driving, parking or walking at Gosport sea front at high tide. Large waves can carry and throw shingle and debris, which will affect the main road at Stokes Bay. We will remove this message by 18:00 on 02/08/2023.
